findings.title: User Balances manipulation
findings.description: Contract owners or any other third party should not be able to access funds belonging to users.

findings.title: Data Consistency
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply manipulation
findings.description: Tokens can be minted only according to rules specified in a whitepaper or any other documentation provided by the Customer.

findings.title: H01. Denial of Service Vulnerability
findings.description: Execution of the code should never be blocked by a specific contract state unless required.

findings.title: H02. Unverifiable Logic
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: H03. Data Consistency
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: M01. Inefficient Gas Model
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: M02. Inefficient Gas Model
findings.description: Importing contracts directly increases the bytecode size of the deployed smart contract.

findings.title: M03. Unchecked Transfer
findings.description: An unchecked transferFrom() function is used in the transfer() function, which may lead to denial of service vulnerabilities when interacting with non-standard ERC20 tokens.

findings.title: M04. Violated Checks-Effects-Interactions Pattern
findings.description: The code does not follow the Check-Effect-Interaction pattern, which can lead to reentrancy attacks or other security issues.

findings.title: M05. Best Practice Violation - Lock of Native Tokens
findings.description: The contract accepts native tokens in the executeMetaTransaction() payable function, but there are no mechanisms for withdrawals, which may lead to native coins being locked in the contract.

findings.title: L01. Floating Pragma
findings.description: Locking the pragma helps to ensure that contracts are not accidentally deployed using an outdated compiler version that might introduce bugs that affect the contract system negatively.

findings.title: L02. Inconsistent Usage of External Libraries
findings.description: Inconsistent usage of external libraries can lead to potential security risks and inconsistencies.

findings.title: L03. Redundant Imports
findings.description: Consider removing redundant code.

findings.title: L04. Style Guide Violation
findings.description: The project should follow official code style guidelines by ordering elements within contracts, libraries, or interfaces and grouping functions according to their visibility.

findings.title: L05. Unfinished NatSpec
findings.description: The code should be kept clean and properly documented with NatSpec. There are multiple functions, structs, and public storage variables that are missing proper NatSpec documentation.

findings.title: L06. State Variables that Could Be Declared as Constant
findings.description: Variables in the contract can be declared as constants to save Gas.

findings.title: L07. Missing Zero Address Validation
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Comment Contradiction
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: L09. Comment Contradiction
findings.description: Spelling error in the name() function NatSpec description: "fallsback"

findings.title: L10. Comment Contradiction
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Comment Contradiction
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: L12. Unclear Use of the Virtual Specifier
findings.description: There are functions in the contracts that are declared with the virtual specifier but are not expected to be overridden, making the use of the virtual specifier redundant.

findings.title: L13. Functions that Can Be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called in the contract should be declared as external to save Gas.

findings.title: L14. Redundant Use of Override Specifier
findings.description: The approve() function does not need the override specifier in its declaration.

findings.title: L15. Code Consistency
findings.description: It is best practice to write code uniformly.

findings.title: Code Consistency
findings.description: It is best practice to write code uniformly.

findings.title: L17. Unindexed Events
findings.description: Events are not indexed which can cause performance issues.

findings.title: L18. State Variable Default Visibility
findings.description: State variables are marked as public by default and can lead to unnecessary view functions being generated, making it harder to catch incorrect assumptions about who can access the variable.
